examples: The suspects are in the wind.
One suspects that he is writing with tongue in cheek.
The police searched the suspect's house for evidence.
The suspect has been on the hook in the interrogation room for about 12 hours now.
I suspect the management is dragging its heels on this issue.
words.defineEn: to think that someone has committed a crime, without proof
words.defineVi: để nghĩ rằng ai đó đã phạm tội, mà không có bằng chứng

examples: The suspense is killing me.
His moments of silence hold the room in suspense.
These build suspense leading up to a product reveal.
Placing the reader in a character’s perspective can build urgency and suspense.
This can create suspense as the reader finds out information along with the character.
words.defineEn: an uncertain cognitive state
words.defineVi: một trạng thái nhận thức không chắc chắn

examples: He gave me a suspicious look.
I called the police hotline to report a suspicious activity.
The wife, probably already suspicious of her husband, then follows the couple and catches them red-handed.
The politician's excessive flattery towards his colleagues made them suspicious, and they reminded each other that flattery like perfume should be smelled but not swallowed.
They're suspicious.
words.defineEn: doubtful about the honesty of what someone has done and having no trust in them
words.defineVi: nghi ngờ về tính trung thực của những gì ai đó đã làm và không tin tưởng vào họ

examples: So, we need collective help from the national government.
Collective judgments were doomed to be extreme.
But when Hulse and Taylor published their results in 1975, the astronomy world lost its collective mind.
This is an initiative, a collective.
Each league sets through the collective bargaining agreement with player unions.
words.defineEn: involving, done, or shared by all members of a group
words.defineVi: liên quan, thực hiện hoặc chia sẻ bởi tất cả các thành viên của một nhóm

examples: The antique collector stumbled upon a collection of vintage candles made from tallow.
Despite the challenges faced by the traditional music industry, vinyl records are alive and kicking, experiencing a resurgence in popularity among audiophiles and collectors.
Most collectors work on monthly quotas.
Many fields do rely on amateur collectors.
Collectors index and organize their possessions.
words.defineEn: someone who collects things, as a job or hobby
words.defineVi: một người thu thập mọi thứ, như một công việc hoặc sở thích

examples: But the issue of immigration is so visceral.
He's visceral.
We call this visceral fat.
You're connected to it, it's the visceral feeling.
Several hours away from Alipur's hideout, in rural Bamiyan province, people live in the shadow of a visceral symbol of the country's culture and its destructive war.
words.defineEn: relating to or affecting the viscera
words.defineVi: liên quan đến hoặc ảnh hưởng đến nội tạng

words.defineEn: having the sticky properties of an adhesive
words.defineVi: có đặc tính dính của chất kết dính

examples: But the bottom of the equation is viscosity of the fluid.
The kinematic viscosity is nu.
Kinematic viscosity is also referred to as the Diffusivity of Momentum.
Viscosity works against disruption, making the flow laminar instead.
OK simply put, viscosity is the measure of the thickness of a fluid.
words.defineEn: resistance of a liquid to shear forces (and hence to flow)
words.defineVi: sức cản của chất lỏng đối với lực cắt (và do đó chảy)

words.defineEn: a British peer who ranks below an earl and above a baron
words.defineVi: một người ngang hàng người Anh xếp dưới một bá tước và trên một nam tước

words.defineEn: having the sticky properties of an adhesive
words.defineVi: có đặc tính dính của chất kết dính

words.defineEn: human-centered
words.defineVi: lấy con người làm trung tâm

words.defineEn: an inclination to evaluate reality exclusively in terms of human values
words.defineVi: một khuynh hướng đánh giá thực tế độc quyền về giá trị con người

words.defineEn: a group of primates that includes human beings, as well as other species that are closely related to humans
words.defineVi: một nhóm động vật linh trưởng bao gồm con người, cũng như các loài khác có liên quan chặt chẽ với con người

examples: Sciences from anthropology to zoology have been put to forensic use.
But within the field of anthropology, changes were in the works.
Ted Gordon is an anthropology professor at the College of Saint Benedict and Saint John's University who focuses on Native American studies.
That means, this method could answer some of the biggest questions in paleontology, archaeology, and anthropology.
It touches on literature, history, anthropology, sociology, psychology, religion, and even science.
words.defineEn: the study of the origins and developments of the human race and its societies and cultures
words.defineVi: nghiên cứu về nguồn gốc và sự phát triển của loài người cũng như các xã hội và nền văn hóa của nó

words.defineEn: suggesting human characteristics for animals or inanimate things
words.defineVi: gợi ý đặc điểm của con người cho động vật hoặc những thứ vô tri vô giác

examples: [Laughs] I don't want to healthy-mind-healthy-body myself into an oblivion.

If this is the case, we just have to venture to the stars and become the first Type Three civilization, To keep the delicate flame of life existing, and to spread it until the universe breathes its final breath, and vanishes into oblivion.
Because I found that guy behind a cabinet a couple of months ago, so I took him out to take some pictures and then I didn't feel like putting him back in the dark depths of oblivion.
Well, as convenient as burning our trash into oblivion might sound, a couple of major reasons to consider.
We’ve all had them, and many of us have spent more than a few minutes squeezing them into oblivion in front of the bathroom mirror.
words.defineEn: the state of being disregarded or forgotten
words.defineVi: tình trạng bị coi thường hoặc lãng quên

examples: Despite his friends shouting his name repeatedly, Mark remained oblivious, completely deaf as a post to their calls for attention.
For Jeremy, ignorance was bliss as he remained oblivious to his failing grade in chemistry class.
In dreamland, we’re oblivious to bed bug chow time.
Boyfriend was somehow oblivious to the whole thing.
I mean, the reaction is oblivious, to some extent, about the blowback.
words.defineEn: (followed by `to' or `of') lacking conscious awareness of
words.defineVi: (theo sau là `to' hoặc `of') thiếu nhận thức có ý thức về

examples: It requires fortitude.
Honestly, so much of this can and will come with time and experience if you have the fortitude and patience.
words.defineEn: mental and emotional strength and resilience in facing adversity, challenges, or difficult situations
words.defineVi: sức mạnh tinh thần và cảm xúc và khả năng phục hồi khi đối mặt với nghịch cảnh, thử thách hoặc tình huống khó khăn

examples: The fortifying agent increases product's nutritional value by adding essential vitamins and minerals to it.
The fortified energy bar contained a fortifying agent that provided an additional dose of protein and fiber for sustained energy.
So this rice milk is fortified with 30% of the daily value.
Armor fortified with iron and zinc.
They're mostly not fortified with other nutrients like potassium.
words.defineEn: to secure a place and make it resistant against attacks, particularly by building walls around it
words.defineVi: để đảm bảo một nơi và làm cho nó chống lại các cuộc tấn công, đặc biệt là bằng cách xây dựng các bức tường xung quanh nó

examples: This next fortuitous discovery is an oldie but a goodie: the invention of the implantable pacemaker.

A far less fortuitous handshake of note took place at the 1901 Pan-American Exposition in Buffalo, when Leon Czolgosz shook president William McKinley’s hand with his left hand while firing two shots from a gun hidden in his right.
It's the opposite of the more well-known and much more fortuitous placebo effect.
I was there at a very fortuitous time 'cause I was there with Lovitz, Dana Carvey, Kevin Nealon, Jan Hooks.
And the timing of it was sort of fortuitous for General Motors because the second Gulf War was starting and all over the news, all you saw were military Humvees storming into Iraq.
words.defineEn: occurring by chance and not intention
words.defineVi: xảy ra một cách tình cờ và không cố ý
